Command or Action
enable Example: Router> enable
configure terminal Example: Router# configure terminal
aaa accounting vrrs { default | list-name start-stop [method1 [method2...]] Example: Router(config)# aaa accounting vrrs vrrp-mlist-1 start-stop group radius
aaa attribute list list-name Example: Router(config)# aaa attribute list vrrp-1-attr
attribute type name value [service service] [protocol protocol] [mandatory] [ tag tag-value] Example: Router(config-attr-list)# attribute type account-delay "10"
exit Example: Router(config-attr-list)# exit
vrrs vrrs-group-name Example: Router(config)# vrrs vrrp-name-1
accounting delay delay Example: Router(config-vrrs)# accounting delay 10
accounting method {default | accounting-method-list} Example: Router(config-vrrs)# accounting method METHOD1
attribute list list-name Example: Router(config-vrrs)# attribute list vrrp-1-attr
Purpose
Enables privileged EXEC mode. Enter your password if prompted.
Enters global configuration mode.
Enables AAA accounting of requested services for billing or security purposes when you use VRRS.
Defines a AAA attribute list locally on a router.
Defines an attribute type that is to be added to an attribute list locally on a router.
Exits attribute list configuration mode and returns to global configuration mode.
(Optional) Specifies a distinct AAA accounting method list to use, a nonzero delay time for accounting-off messages, and additional attributes other than the default for a VRRP group.
(Optional) Specifies a delay time for sending accounting-off messages for VRRS.
(Optional) Enables VRRS accounting for a VRRP group.
(Optional) Specifies additional attributes to include in VRRS accounting-on and accounting-off messages.
pageTitle: First Hop Redundancy Protocols Configuration Guide, Cisco IOS XE Release 3S - Virtual Router Redundancy Service [Cisco IOS XE 3S] - Cisco
